item.title: Dylan Rich: Young footballer who died was much-loved, says head
item.description: Dylan Rich, 17, is suspected to have had a cardiac arrest during a game in Nottinghamshire.

item.title: Plymouth shooting: Hundreds mourn toddler and dad
item.description: Sophie Martyn was walking with her father Lee, 43, when they were shot dead by Jake Davison.

item.title: Kickboxer Saeideh Aletaha: Brothers feared fatal fight was unfair
item.description: Saeideh Aletaha, 26, died a day after being knocked out at an organised bout in Southampton in 2019.

item.title: Meteor caught on camera over Southampton docks
item.description: The shooting star was captured on camera over Southampton docks on Sunday night.

item.title: Rapper Wiley charged with east London assault and burglary
item.description: Wiley is accused of assault by beating and burglary with intent to cause criminal damage.

item.title: Red Funnel Southampton check-in kiosk flattened by lorry
item.description: Staff members and passengers rush to help three people working inside a ferry kiosk in Southampton.

item.title: Claudia Lawrence: New leads after search offer no hope, mum says
item.description: Joan Lawrence says she cannot live in hope of a breakthrough in solving her daughter's disappearance.

item.title: Manchester Arena Inquiry: Ambulance boss defends paramedics decision
item.description: Gerard Blezard says a mass casualty vehicle should have been deployed to the Manchester Arena.

item.title: Nadia Whittome: MP back at work after leave of absence with PTSD
item.description: Nadia Whittome, Labour MP for Nottingham East, says she is making a "good recovery".

item.title: Marcus Rashford says child food poverty 'devastatingly' worse
item.description: The footballer urges people to write to their MP as a survey indicates food poverty is worsening.

item.title: Godiva Festival headliners Sister Sledge rescued by taxi
item.description: Tour manager Bernard Young says the band faced difficulty with a "messed up car".

item.title: 'I hid my litter picker in my suitcase'
item.description: Jenny I'Anson, 73, says she can spend up to five hours a day clearing rubbish.

item.title: NHS wait times: 'Iâ€™m not half the man I was'
item.description: Wayne Dennis, 50, has been waiting more than two years for treatment to his gallbladder.

item.title: Chipping Norton big vegetable grower becomes Twitter hit
item.description: Gerald Stratford says fertiliser and patience are behind his vegetables growing so big.

item.title: Ironbridge power station chimney demolished
item.description: The last major structure at the Ironbridge Power Station is brought down in a controlled explosion.

item.title: Wirral Mind fundraiser completes year of daily 10km runs
item.description: Phill Hayward kept his challenge interesting by going runs while dribbling a ball and running in heels.

item.title: Commons Speaker Sir Lindsay Hoyle: I've received death threats
item.description: Sir Lindsay Hoyle urges fellow MPs to be "careful" but not to be deterred from doing their job.

item.title: Shropshire baby deaths: Hospital dismissed mum's fears
item.description: Charlotte Jackson's son died after she reported fluid loss to staff at an under-fire hospital trust.

item.title: Maisie Summers-Newton: Crowds welcome home Paralympic double gold medallist
item.description: Paralympic double gold medallist Maisie Summers-Newton returns home to rapturous applause and cheering.

item.title: REME recruit's 30 hour-swim through 11 lakes for charity
item.description: Elly Kent, 26, says she was kept going by the Lake District's "priceless views".

item.title: Seal population a barometer of River Thames's health
item.description: Researchers say the river is healthier than people might think and teeming with wildlife.

item.title: London's unemployment situation explained
item.description: Why is the capital's unemployment rate is higher than the rest of the UK?

item.title: US Open 2021: Emma Raducanu ready to face Shelby Rogers in New York
item.description: British teenager Emma Raducanu is unfazed by the prospect of playing home favourite Shelby Rogers on Arthur Ashe Stadium in the US Open last 16.

item.title: Toby Flood: Ex-England, Leicester and Newcastle fly-half retires
item.description: Former England, Leicester and Newcastle fly-half Toby Flood retires from rugby union at the age of 36.

item.title: Saka 'doesn't need closure' says Southgate after forward's goal in England win v Andorra
item.description: Gareth Southgate says Bukayo Saka "does not need closure" after scoring on his first Wembley outing since missing the decisive penalty in England's Euro 2020 final loss to Italy.
